Framework¶

This module contains functions that are essential to the automation of this framework.

It contains functions that leverage existing functionality to do the following:

  • Process all OSM graph dumps in a specified directory
  • Convert these processed files into networkx graphs
  • Calculate the metrics for these graphs
  • Generate powerlawfit graphs if desired

This code is copyright (c) 2013, Abdulfatai Popoola under the GPL License

framework.buildScatterPlotData(xAxisDataList, yAxisDataList, labels, clustersKeyList, xAxisLabel, yAxisLabel)[source]¶

Creates a dictionary containing all the data needed to make a scatter plot

Parameters:
  • xAxisDataList – A list of values for the x Axis data
  • yAxisDataList – A list of values for the y Axis data
  • labels – labels for each entry in the lists above
  • clustersKeyList – keys for each clustering unit for the data
  • xAxisLabel – label for the xAxisData
  • yAxisLabel – label for the yAxisData
Return type:

A dictionary containing all the above values
framework.drawPlots(citiesInfoList, xAxisDataDict, xAxisLabel, clusterInfoDict, plotFileName)[source]¶

This function generates all plots based on the information given. This function generates pdf, eps and svg copies of the same plot.

Parameters:
  • citiesInfoList – A list of dictionaries containing values that will be plotted on the vertical axis’
  • xAxisDataDict – A dictionary mapping city names to values for the x-Axis, city names in this dictionary must match the city names in the data list exactly
  • xAxisLabel – The label for the xAxis data.
  • clusterInfoDict – A dictionary mapping cities to their clustering group; this is used in determing the colours to add to plots; as before, city names in this dictionary must match the city names in the data list exactly
  • plotFileName – The name for the generated plot file
framework.generatePlots(xPlotsList, processedCityData, infoType='')[source]¶

Generates plots based on processedCityData and the values for the horizontal axis. :param xPlotsList: A list of dictionaries corresponding to specific data. Each list holds information that will be used to represent a city on the horizontal axis. Plots will be generated for each dictionary in this list. :param processedCityData: A list of City objects. :param infoType: The type of plots to generate: raw City Information, normalized City Information or both. :rtype: A list of City objects which have invalid data and can not appear on plots.

framework.getAllOSMFiles(directory='.')[source]¶

Retrieves all OSM files in the specified directory, defaults to the current directory if no directory is given.

Parameters:directory – directory to search for OSM files
Return type:list of all the OSM filenames
framework.getPlots(data, xAxisDataDict, clusterInfo, infoType='')[source]¶

Plot scatter plots for a list of City objects

Parameters:
  • data – A list of City objects. See Core
  • xAxisDataDict – A dictionary mapping city names to values for the x-Axis, city names in this dictionary must match the city names in the data list exactly
  • clusterInfo – A dictionary mapping cities to their clustering group; this is used in determing the colours to add to plots; as before, city names in this dictionary must match the city names in the data list exactly
  • infoType – The type of plots to generate; can be those of raw processed information, normalized information or both.
Return type:

Returns cities for which the powerlaw iteration did not converge
framework.getValuesForAllCities(citiesList, tag)[source]¶

Gets all the cities values for a tag e.g. entropy citiesList is a list of city dictionaries

Parameters:
  • citiesList – A list of processed cities.
  • tag – The tag to be extracted.
Return type:

A list of tuples with each tag containing the city name and the tag value for that city.
framework.getXPlotsListOfDictionaries(CSVFile)[source]¶

Reads a CSV file to get all the corresponding xAxisValues for the processed cities. This information is passed to the graph plotting function to serve as data for the horizontal x Axis.

Parameters:CSVFile – CSVFile is a CSV file containing city names and their associated data such as area, population
Return type:A list of dictionaries for each possible city and column pairing in the CSVFile, each list corresponds to a column in the CSVFile and each dictionary in a list contains the city name and the corresponding data for that column.
framework.runProcess(OSMdir, boundingBoxCSVFile, plotPowerLaws=False)[source]¶

Processes all OSM graphs located in a given directory and returns a list of City objects.

Parameters:
  • OSMdir – The directory containing OSM files
  • boundingBoxCSVFile – A CSV file containing a list of city names and their corresponding bounding box coordinates. The city names in this CSV file must match the names in the OSMdir absolutely. An example is {u’west’: 18.4287748, u’east’: 18.9478418, u’north’: 54.4472188, u’south’: 54.2749559},gdansk.
  • plotPowerLaws – Flag to determine if powerlaw fit plots will be generated for each city in the OSMdir
Return type:

list of processed City Objects. See Core
